macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: FTSE 100 Reaches New Record High
items.summary: London's benchmark index advanced 0.8% to close at 10,124.60 points, with gains led by Glencore. Precious metals also edged higher following data pointing to a slowdown in the US labour market.

items.title: Dow Jones Reaches New Record on Amazon Rally and AI Optimism
items.summary: The US blue-chip index rose 0.5% to 49,221.13, extending its rally with strong gains in Amazon driving the advance.

items.title: S&P 500 Breaks to New All-Time High
items.summary: After a meaningful dip last week, the US stock market recovered with the S&P 500 breaking to a new all-time high on Friday, though bullish momentum appears to have slowed.

items.title: Precious Metals Rally on Softer Labour Market Data
items.summary: Gold rose 1.4% to $4,511 per troy ounce with weekly gains around 4%, while silver jumped 5% to $79.79 an ounce, extending weekly increases to about 9%, following US labour market slowdown signals.

items.title: S&P 500 Positioned for Fourth Consecutive Year of Gains
items.summary: Canaccord Genuity argues there is a 'strong case for a 4th positive year' in 2026, citing a strengthening economy, expected modest growth acceleration, controlled inflation, and continued rate cuts.

items.title: US Dollar Index Shows Bullish Signals
items.summary: The US Dollar Index printed a large bullish candlestick last week, supported by slightly stronger than expected US economic data that gave a hawkish tilt against rate cut expectations, though two 0.25% rate cuts remain widely expected in 2026.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin holds around $90.7K as crypto market cap edges above $3.09T
items.summary: Over the past 24 hours Bitcoin traded in a tight range between roughly $90,404 and $90,850, last seen near $90,766, while the total cryptocurrency market capitalization inched up about 0.10% to $3.09 trillion, with major large-cap coins showing mixed but generally modest moves.

items.title: Ethereum, BNB, and Solana post modest gains amid broadly stable majors
items.summary: Ethereum traded near $3,106, up about 0.47% on the day, BNB rose roughly 1.58% to around $915, and Solana gained about 0.39% to approximately $136.7, as most top cryptocurrencies by market cap saw small, mixed price changes over the last 24 hours.

items.title: Select altcoins surge with HYPER up 25% among top Binance gainers
items.summary: While the broader market remained relatively calm, several smaller-cap tokens listed on Binance saw sharp intraday rallies, led by HYPER/USDT gaining 25%, 币安人生/USDT rising 21%, and BIFI/USDT climbing 16% over the last 24 hours.

items.title: Bitcoin trades near $90.6K as analysts warn of potential drop toward $70K region
items.summary: Bitcoin is attempting a modest rebound of roughly 0.24% around $90,605 after five consecutive days of declines, with one widely cited technical analysis calling for a possible 25% correction that could push BTC into the $68,000–$74,000 range, and some strategists mapping scenarios that include further downside toward the mid-$60,000s.

items.title: Bitcoin consolidates around $90–91K after volatile week, market cap near $3.1T
items.summary: Following pronounced swings earlier in the week, Bitcoin is consolidating near the psychologically important $90,000–$91,000 band as total crypto market capitalization stabilizes around $3.1 trillion, with Ethereum holding about $3,200 and Solana benefiting from prior U.S. spot ETF-driven inflows.

items.title: Bitcoin mining difficulty records first adjustment of 2026 with slight dip
items.summary: Bitcoin’s mining difficulty fell slightly to about 146.4 trillion in the first network adjustment of 2026 after a year of record-high difficulty and compressed miner margins, with the next change projected around January 22 and expected to bring a modest uptick as average block times remain just under the 10-minute target.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Spending to Reach $2 Trillion in 2026, Marking 'Second Inning' of AI Revolution
items.summary: Analyst Dan Ives projects that global AI spending will reach approximately $2 trillion in 2026, with more money to be spent in the next two years than the past decade combined. Ives characterizes this as a '1996 moment' rather than speculative excess, with enterprise and government investment reflecting real infrastructure build-out.

items.title: NVIDIA Unveils Dual Infrastructure Strategy for 2026: Rubin Platform and Physical AI Ecosystem
items.summary: NVIDIA announced its 2026 strategy centered on two parallel infrastructure layers: the Rubin S-curve platform targeting industrial AI compute with token generation costs reduced to one-tenth of previous levels, and a physical AI ecosystem for autonomous systems. The company also introduced Alpamayo, an open reasoning model for autonomous vehicle development.

items.title: Agentic AI Transitions from Theory to Practice, Reshaping Work and HR Processes
items.summary: Agentic AI has moved from conceptual discussion to real-world implementation, fundamentally changing how organizations approach automation. Unlike earlier task-based automation, Agentic AI now replaces or restructures entire processes, prompting HR leaders to reconsider which decisions should remain human-controlled.

items.title: Five Key AI Technology Clusters Driving 2026 Innovation
items.summary: Emerging AI trends focus on five major clusters: machine learning fundamentals, natural language processing, data analytics and optimization, generative AI for content creation, and computer vision with autonomous systems. These advancements are expected to transform technology, data, and healthcare sectors.
